source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Brassicaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Brassicaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant with irregularly branched or stellate hairs, at least on lower parts of plant
Upper parts of plant (particularly sepals) glabrous or with scattered or patchy hairs; leaves of lower stem usually pinnately- or 3-lobed
Entire plant densely covered by appressed, velvety hairs; leaves all entire or broadly toothed
